t: Chapter 13 Physician License by Conceded Eminence

"Applicant" means an individual applying for initial licensure as a physici
"Application period" means the time between the filing of an application an
"Board" means the Board of Physicians.
"Conceded eminence and authority in the profession" means significant teach

"Last author" means the last named author of a publication such as a resear
"LCME" means Liaison Committee on Medical Education of the American College
"LMCC" means Licentiate of the Medical Council of Canada, or its successor.
"Malpractice history" means a list of claims filed against a health care pr

Special Purpose Examination prepared by the Federation of State Medical Boa

"World Health Organization directory" means the World Directory of Medical

c.t: .03 Qualifications for Special License by Conceded Eminence.

c.x: Complete an application on a form supplied by the Board;
Pay an application fee set by the Board in COMAR 10.32.01.12;
Be of good moral character; and
Be at least 18 years old.
